get.summary:
Returns the folders the current user has access to.
The response will be a list of folders; the hierarchy can be reconstructed
using the ParentId properties. From the root to the folders the user has
actually been assigned to, the folders will be marked as non-selectable
and only the paths to the assigned-to folders will be included.
From the assigned-to folders down to the leaves, the nodes will be marked as
selectable and their children lists fully populated.
get.description:
OAuth authentication is not supported.

Requires authentication.

get.summary:
Returns a page of the user-folder assignments for the input user, including the roles for each folder.
The response also includes the folders assigned to the directory groups of the user.
The distinction between the folders assigned directly to the user and the ones assigned to one of his groups
can be made via the User field of the response.
get.description:
OAuth authentication is not supported.

Required permissions: (Units.View - Gets roles from all folders) and (SubFolders.View - Gets roles only from folders where caller has SubFolders.View permission).

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: User name

get.summary:
Returns a subset (paginated) of direct children for a given folder, which are accessible to the current user.
To ease a folder tree structure navigation design, the list of ancestors for the given folder is also returned.
get.description:
OAuth authentication is not supported.

Requires authentication.

get.summary: Returns a filtered subset (paginated) of the folders the current user has access to.

post.summary: Inserts a log entry with a specified message in JSON format.
post.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Monitoring or OR.Monitoring.Write.

Required permissions: (Logs.Create).

Example of jMessage parameter.
            
     {
         "message": "TTT execution started",
         "level": "Information",
         "timeStamp": "2017-01-18T14:46:07.4152893+02:00",
         "windowsIdentity": "DESKTOP-1L50L0P\\WindowsUser",
         "agentSessionId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
         "processName": "TTT",
         "fileName": "Main",
         "jobId": "8066c309-cef8-4b47-9163-b273fc14cc43"
     }
DEPRECATED: 
Use SubmitLogs instead
Please refer to https://docs.uipath.com/orchestrator/reference

200.description: Successfully inserts a log message. Although it's a post, there's no need for an object to be returned

400.description: jMessage is null or an Exception is thrown during insert

408.description: Too many pending logging requests or timeout

         "processName": "TTT",
         "fileName": "Main",

parameters.description: Indicates the related entities to be represented inline. The maximum depth is 2.

parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned. The maximum number of expressions is 100.

parameters.description: Limits the properties returned in the result.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specifies the order in which items are returned. The maximum number of expressions is 5.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Limits the number of items returned from a collection. The maximum value is 1000.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Excludes the specified number of items of the queried collection from the result.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Indicates whether the total count of items within a collection are returned in the result.

get.summary: Gets folders.
get.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Read.

Required permissions: (Units.View or SubFolders.View - Gets all folders or only the folders where user has SubFolders.View permission).

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Indicates the related entities to be represented inline. The maximum depth is 2.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned. The maximum number of expressions is 100.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Limits the properties returned in the result.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specifies the order in which items are returned. The maximum number of expressions is 5.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Limits the number of items returned from a collection. The maximum value is 1000.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Excludes the specified number of items of the queried collection from the result.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Indicates whether the total count of items within a collection are returned in the result.

post.summary: Creates a new folder.
post.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Write.

Required permissions: (Units.Create or SubFolders.Create - Creates root or subfolder or only subfolder if user has SubFolders.Create permission on parent).

put.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Write.

Required permissions: (Units.Delete or SubFolders.Delete - Move any folder or to folder only if user has SubFolders.Delete permission on it) and (Units.Create or SubFolders.Create - Move to any target folder or to folder if user has SubFolders.Create permission on target) and (Units.Edit or SubFolders.Edit - Move to any target folder or to folder if user has SubFolders.Edit permission on target).

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Id of the folder to be moved

parameters.name: targetParentId
parameters.description: Id of the target parent

get.summary: Gets a single folder, based on its Id.

OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Read.

parameters.description: Indicates the related entities to be represented inline. The maximum depth is 2.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Limits the properties returned in the result.

OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Write.

delete.summary:
Deletes a folder. Succeeds only if no entities or user associations
exist in this folder or any of its descendants.
delete.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Write.

Required permissions: (Units.Delete or SubFolders.Delete - Deletes any folder or only if user has SubFolders.Delete permission on the provided folder).

OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Write.

Required permissions: (Units.Edit or SubFolders.Edit - Removes machines from any folder or only if caller has SubFolders.Edit permission the folder provided).

parameters.description: The Ids of the machines to remove from the folder

post.summary: Remove user assignment from a folder.
post.description:

parameters.description: userId - The Id of the user to remove from the folder

get.summary:
Returns a page of the user-folder assignments for the input user, including the roles for each folder.
The response also includes the folders assigned to the directory groups of the user.
The distinction between the folders assigned directly to the user and the ones assigned to one of his groups
can be made via the User field of the response.
LIMITATION: If URI parameters contain special characters (eg. \, /), use instead api/FoldersNavigation/GetAllRolesForUser endpoint.
get.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Folders or OR.Folders.Read.

Required permissions: (Units.View or SubFolders.View - Gets roles from all folders or only from folders where user has SubFolders.View permission).

OAuth required scopes: OR.Queues or OR.Queues.Read.

Requires authentication.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Indicates the related entities to be represented inline. The maximum depth is 2.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Limits the properties returned in the result.

parameters.name: X-UIPATH-OrganizationUnitId
parameters.description: Folder/OrganizationUnit Id

get.summary: Get the queues from all the folders in which the current user has the Queues.View permission, except the ones in the excluded folder.
get.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Queues or OR.Queues.Read.

Requires authentication.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Indicates the related entities to be represented inline. The maximum depth is 2.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Restricts the set of items returned. The maximum number of expressions is 100.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Limits the properties returned in the result.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specifies the order in which items are returned. The maximum number of expressions is 5.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Limits the number of items returned from a collection. The maximum value is 1000.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Excludes the specified number of items of the queried collection from the result.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Indicates whether the total count of items within a collection are returned in the result.

parameters.name: X-UIPATH-OrganizationUnitId
parameters.description: Folder/OrganizationUnit Id

post.summary: Makes the queue visible in the specified folders.

get.summary:
Gets the execution settings configuration (display name, value type, etc.).
If scope is 0 (Global), the default values will be the initial ones. If scope is 1 (Robot), then
the default values will be the actual values set globally.
e.g., Resolution width
Assume it was set globally to 720.
Then within the config returned by this function, the default value for this setting will be:
- 0 for scope = 0 and
- 720 for scope = 1.
get.description:
OAuth required scopes: OR.Settings or OR.Settings.Read.

Required permissions: Settings.Edit or Robots.Create or Robots.Edit.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of the configuration; 0 for Global, 1 for Robot

AlertDto.description: Stores notification data used to inform the users about specific application events.

NotificationName.description: The name of a specific type of notification, e.g. Robot.StatusChanged.NotResponding.

Data.description: Stores data about the context in which the event occurred, in JSON format.

Component.description: The component that raised the alert.

Severity.description: The severity level of the alert.

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the alert was generated.

State.description:
Defines if a specified notification has been read or not.
<para />Members: Unread (0) - the specified notification has not been marked as read; Read (1) - the specified notification has been marked as read.

UserNotificationId.description: The database unique identifier for the alert notification sent to the current user.

DeepLinkRelativeUrl.description:
Relative deep link for front-end usage.
e.g /alerts/deeplink/{alert_title}?{alert_param1}={alert_param1_value}&{alert_param2}={alert_param2_value}

AssetDto.description: Stores specific data so that robots can easily have access to it.

Name.description: A custom name for the asset.

CanBeDeleted.description: States if an assets can be deleted. The default value of this property is true.

ValueScope.description: Defines the scope of the asset.

ValueType.description: Defines the type of value stored by the asset.

Value.description: The textual representation of the asset value, irrespective of value type.

StringValue.description: The value of the asset when the value type is Text. Empty when the value type is not Text.

BoolValue.description: The value of the asset when the value type is Bool. False when the value type is not Bool.

IntValue.description: The value of the asset when the value type is Integer. 0 when the value type is not Integer.

CredentialUsername.description: The user name when the value type is Credential. Empty when the value type is not Credential.

CredentialPassword.description: The password when the value type is Credential. Empty when the value type is not Credential.

ExternalName.description: Contains the value of the key in the external store used to store the credentials.

CredentialStoreId.description: The Credential Store used to store the credentials.

KeyValueList.description: A collection of key value pairs when the type is KeyValueList. Empty when the value type is not KeyValueList.

HasDefaultValue.description:
The asset has a default value set. This value will be null when set from legacy components that don't support
the PerRobot assets with default value feature.

Description.description: The description of the asset.

RobotValues.description: The collection of asset values per robot. Empty if the asset type is Global or PerUser.

UserValues.description: The collection of asset values per user. Empty if the asset type is Global or PerRobot.

FoldersCount.description: Number of folders where the asset is shared.

AuditLogDto.description: Stores audit information about any action performed in Orchestrator.

ServiceName.description: The name of the Orchestrator service that performed a given action in the system.

MethodName.description: The name of the service method that performed a given action in the system.

Parameters.description: JSON representation of the method parameters and their values for the given action.

ExecutionTime.description: The date and time when the action was performed.

Action.description: The action performed (create, update, delete etc)

Component.description: The component for which the action was performed

DisplayName.description: The display name of the resource acted on, usually Name

EntityId.description: The Id of the resource acted on

OperationText.description: User friendly description of the change, e.g. "User X created robot Y"

UserType.description: The type of user that sent the request

ExternalClientId.description: External client identifier. Example: OAuth 3rd party app identifier that called Orchestrator.

UserIsDeleted.description: Marks whether the users that did the action was deleted in the meantime

AuditLogId.description: Business audit entry that triggered the changes

EntityId.description: The Id of the referred entity

EntityName.description: The name of the entity the auditLog refers to

Name.description: Display name of the Bucket

Description.description: Description of the Bucket

StorageProvider.description:
Provider Name.
Otherwise one of the supported providers:
- FileSystem
- Azure
- Amazon
- Minio
- S3Compatible
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

StorageParameters.description:
Provider specific initialization parameters.
Use a $Password for where the password should be inserted.
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

StorageContainer.description:
Provider specific Container name (AWS, WASB).
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

CredentialStoreId.description:
Credential store used to keep the provider access password.
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

ExternalName.description:
The external name of the password in the credential store.
If null, it defaults to the bucket name.
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

Password.description:
Provider specific password/secret.
It is inserted as a replacement of the $Password token in the StorageParameters.
Leave null for built-in Orchestrator host provider.

FoldersCount.description: Number of folders where the bucket is shared.

errorMessage.description: Gets or sets the translated message of error occurred during this task's operation.

taskCatalogId.description: Action Catalog to be associated with the tasks

resourceType.description:
This enum describes the type of resources that can be stored in the Credential Store. When
a new resource type is added, the default needs to be initialized in 3 places:
1. Existing tenants: At migration time.
2. Default tenant: At seed time in DefaultTenantCreator.cs.
3. New tenants: In TenantService.cs.

CredentialsProxyResourceDto.description: Defines the resources such as credential stores, assets, robots or bucket for a Credentials Proxy.

Type.description: This enum describes the type of resources that can be affiliated to a Credentials Proxy.

CredentialStoreDto.description: Defines the properties of a Credential Store.

AdditionalConfiguration.description: Additional information specific to the type of the Credential Store.

CredentialStoreResourceDto.description: Defines the resources such as assets, robots or bucket for a Credential Store.

Type.description:
This enum describes the type of resources that can be stored in the Credential Store. When
a new resource type is added, the default needs to be initialized in 3 places:
1. Existing tenants: At migration time.
2. Default tenant: At seed time in DefaultTenantCreator.cs.
3. New tenants: In TenantService.cs.

CustomEventDto.description: An event triggered by a robot Orchestrator activity

CustomKeyValuePair.description: Stores a custom pair of key and value for assets with type KeyValueList.

Key.description: A piece of text representing the key.

Value.description: A piece of text representing the value.

ResourceType.description:
This enum describes the type of resources that can be stored in the Credential Store. When
a new resource type is added, the default needs to be initialized in 3 places:
1. Existing tenants: At migration time.
2. Default tenant: At seed time in DefaultTenantCreator.cs.
3. New tenants: In TenantService.cs.

TaskId.description: Id of Task which have to be edited

TaskCatalogId.description: Action Catalog to be associated with the task

UnsetTaskCatalog.description:
Unset/Unassociate action catalogs with the task
Set to true for unassociating catalog

Name.description: A custom name for the environment.

Description.description: Used to add additional information about an environment in order to better identify it.

Robots.description: The collection of robots associated with the current environment.

Type.description:
DEPRECATED. The environment type specifies how it should be used.
This property is deprecated and should no longer be used.

IsSelectable.description: Determines whether this folder can be selected to view its entities

HasChildren.description: True if this folder has children

FullyQualifiedName.description: Name of folder prepended by the names of its ancestors.

Description.description: Description of folder

ParentId.description: Id of parent folder in the folders hierarchy

ParentKey.description: Unique key for the parent folder

LicenseKey.description:
The key is automatically generated from the server for the Robot machine.
<para />For the robot to work, the same key must exist on both the robot and Orchestrator.
<para />All robots on a machine must have the same license key in order to register correctly.

MachineName.description: The name of the machine a Robot is hosted on.

MachineId.description: The Id of the machine a Robot is hosted on

Name.description: A custom name for the robot.

Username.description:
The machine username. If the user is under a domain, you are required to also specify it in a DOMAIN\username format.
<para />Note: You must use short domain names, such as desktop\administrator and NOT desktop.local/administrator.

ExternalName.description: Contains the value of the key in the external store used to store the password.

Description.description: Used to add additional information about a robot in order to better identify it.

Password.description: The Windows password associated with the machine username.

CredentialStoreId.description: The Credential Store used to store the password.

Enabled.description: Specificies the state of the Robot (enabled/disabled) - a disabled robot cannot connect to Orchestrator

Environments.description: The collection of environments the robot is part of.

RobotEnvironments.description: The comma separated textual representation of environment names the robot is part of.

ExecutionSettings.description: A collection of key value pairs containing execution settings for this robot.

IsExternalLicensed.description: Flag to indicate if the robot uses an external license

LimitConcurrentExecution.description: Specifies if the robot can be used concurrently on multiple machines

FailedQueueItemDto.description: Stores the result of the BulkAddQueueItems operation.

Ordinal.description:
Ordinal of the item that failed.
A value of null means that offending item is unknown.

FullyQualifiedName.description: Name of folder prepended by the names of its ancestors.

Description.description: Description of folder

ParentId.description: Id of parent folder in the folders hierarchy

ParentKey.description: Unique key for the parent folder

FolderRolesDto.description: Association between a folder and a set of roles.

FormTaskCreateRequest.description: Class with only attributes needed for Creating Task (TaskType = TaskType.FormTask)

formLayout.description: Text representing the form layout schema

formLayoutId.description: Unique FormLayoutId for a form layout

bulkFormLayoutId.description: Unique BulkFormLayoutId for a form layout

title.description: Gets or sets title of this task.

priority.description: Gets or sets priority of this task.

taskCatalogName.description: Gets or sets the task catalog/category of the task

externalTag.description: Reference or name of external system

tags.description: List of tags associated to the task.

canConnect.description: Target host is reachable and a succesful TCP connection could be made on the specified port

hasBadSsl.description:
Any error occurred during SSL/TLS authentication.
Includes bad certificates (name mismatch, expired certificates), unsupported protocol versions or cyphersuites

connectionError.description:
An error code that further describes the type of connection error.
Does not include TLS/SSL errors

HostLicenseDto.description: Stores information about the host license used to activate one or more tenants.

TenantsCount.description: The number of tenants licensed from this license file

ExpireDate.description: License expiration date in Epoch format

GracePeriodEndDate.description: License grace period end date in Epoch format

VersionControl.description: The product version which can use this license

Allowed.description: Contains the number of allowed licenses for each type

Used.description: Contains the number of used licenses for each type

AttendedConcurrent.description: States whether the license is Attended Concurrent

DevelopmentConcurrent.description: States whether the license is Development Concurrent

StudioXConcurrent.description: States whether the license is Studio Business Concurrent

StudioProConcurrent.description: States whether the license is Studio Pro Concurrent

LicensedFeatures.description: What features are licensed (valid for individually-licensed features, like Analytics)

IsRegistered.description: True if the current tenant is registered with a license. False otherwise.

IsCommunity.description: True if the current tenant is registered with a community license.

IsProOrEnterprise.description: True if the current tenant is registered with a pro license.

IsExpired.description: States whether the license is still valid or not.

CreationTime.description: The date when the license was uploaded.

UserLicensingEnabled.description: Whether user licensing is enabled or not.

JobCompletedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever a job has completed successfully

JobDto.description: Represents a scheduled or manual execution of a process on a robot.

StartTime.description: The date and time when the job execution started or null if the job hasn't started yet.

EndTime.description: The date and time when the job execution ended or null if the job hasn't ended yet.

State.description: The state in which the job is.

SpecificPriorityValue.description: Value for more granular control over execution priority.

Source.description: The Source name of the job.

SourceType.description: The Source type of the job.

BatchExecutionKey.description: The unique identifier grouping multiple jobs. It is usually generated when the job is created by a schedule.

Info.description: Additional information about the current job.

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the job was created.

StartingScheduleId.description: The Id of the schedule that started the job, or null if the job was started by the user.

ReleaseName.description: The name of the release associated with the current name.

Type.description: The type of the job, Attended if started via the robot, Unattended otherwise

InputArguments.description: Input parameters in JSON format to be passed to job execution

OutputArguments.description: Output parameters in JSON format resulted from job execution

HostMachineName.description: The name of the machine where the Robot run the job.

HasMediaRecorded.description: True if any execution media has been recorded for this job, false otherwise.

HasVideoRecorded.description: True if any execution video has been recorded for this job, false otherwise.

PersistenceId.description: The persistence instance id for a suspended job

ResumeVersion.description: Distinguishes between multiple job suspend/resume cycles

RuntimeType.description: The runtime type of the robot which can pick up the job

EntryPointPath.description: Path to the entry point workflow (XAML) that will be executed by the robot

OrganizationUnitId.description: Id of the folder this job is part of.

OrganizationUnitFullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of the folder this job is part of.

ProfilingOptions.description: Options to instruct the robot what profiling info to collect (code coverage, CPU / memory utilization, etc)

ResumeOnSameContext.description:
Flag for honoring initial machine and robot choice upon resumption of job if suspended.
If set, the job will resume on the same robot-machine pair on which it initially ran.

LocalSystemAccount.description: The account under which the robot executor will run the job

OrchestratorUserIdentity.description: The orchestrator identity used to make API calls

JobFaultedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever a job has failed to finish execution

JobsCreatedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever jobs were created and queued for execution

Jobs.description: List of jobs that were created and are in pending state

JobsStoppedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever jobs were stopped

JobStartedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever a job has started execution on a robot

JobSuspendedEventDto.description: This event is raised whenever a job has suspended execution on a robot

JobTriggerDto.description: A trigger for resuming a job

Status.description: Job trigger status (new, ready, fired etc)

ItemId.description: item Id (queue item id, task id, job id etc)

LogDto.description:
Logs generated by Robots and execution reports. Can be stored in ElasticSearch and/or to a local SQL database.
<para />Note: The endpoint for this type is /odata/RobotLogs URL.

WindowsIdentity.description: The name of the user that performed the action that was logged.

TimeStamp.description: The exact date and time the action was performed.

Message.description: The log message. This can also be a message logged through the Log Message activity in UiPath Studio.

JobKey.description: The key of the job running the process that generated the log, if any.

RawMessage.description: A JSON format message containing all the above fields.

RobotName.description: The name of the Robot that generated the log.

HostMachineName.description: The name of the machine that generated the log

MachineId.description: The Id of the Machine on which the Robot that generated the log is running.

RuntimeType.description: The RuntimeType of the job referenced by the JobKey field

MachineDto.description: The Machine that hosts the Robot

LicenseKey.description:
The key is automatically generated from the server for the Robot machine.
<para />For the robot to work, the same key must exist on both the robot and Orchestrator.
<para />All robots on a machine must have the same license key in order to register correctly.

Name.description: The name of the Machine a Robot is hosted on.

Type.description: The type of the Machine (Standard / Template).

Scope.description: The scope of the Machine (Default / Shared / PW / Cloud / Serverless).

NonProductionSlots.description: Number of NonProduction slots to be reserved at runtime

UnattendedSlots.description: Number of Unattended slots to be reserved at runtime

HeadlessSlots.description: Number of Headless slots to be reserved at runtime

TestAutomationSlots.description: Number of TestAutomation slots to be reserved at runtime

AutomationCloudSlots.description: Number of AutomationCloud slots to be reserved at runtime

AutomationCloudTestAutomationSlots.description: Number of AutomationCloudTestAutomation slots to be reserved at runtime

Key.description: An immutable unique identifier that is preserved during tenant migration

EndpointDetectionStatus.description: The EDR protection status of the connected hosts.

RobotVersions.description: The versions of the Robots hosted on the Machine.

AutoScalingProfiles.description: AutoScaling Profiles assigned to the machine.

AutoScalingProfile.description: The profile that drives auto scaling.

AutomationType.description: The automation type the machine supports.

TargetFramework.description: The target frameworks the machine supports.

ClientSecret.description:
Client secret generated by Identity Server
Use in combination with LicenseKey (ClientId) to connect robot

HostMachineName.description: The name of the machine a Robot is hosted on.

State.description: The value of the last reported status.

ReportingTime.description: The date and time when the last heartbeat came.

Info.description: May store additional information about the robot state.

IsUnresponsive.description: If the robot did not report status for longer than 120 seconds.

Count.description: The number of Robots on the Machine with the specified version.

Version.description: The Version of the Robot hosted on the Machine.

MaintenanceWindowDto.description: Represents a maintenance window for a cloud machine

enabled.description: Whether the maintenance window is enabled

jobStopStrategy.description: The strategy for stopping jobs when the window begins

cronExpression.description: The recurrence pattern as a cron expression

duration.description: The duration of the maintenance window in minutes

nextExecutionTime.description: The next execution time of the maintenance window

MessageTemplateDto.description: Used to store various predefined application message templates like custom login layout.

Name.description: The name of a specific template (e.g. Templates.LoginLayout).

Value.description: The value assigned to a specific template.

OrganizationUnitDto.description:
Stores information about an organization unit in Orchestrator.
<para /> An orchestrator unit can be understood as a company department and it is used to group different entities.

DisplayName.description: The name of the organization unit.

PermissionDto.description: Stores information about an application permission and role association.

Name.description: The name of the application permission.

IsGranted.description: States if a user associated with the role will be allowed or denied to perform the actions governed by the permission.

RoleId.description: The Id of the role associated with the permission.

Scope.description: The application scope in which the permission will be applied

ProcessDto.description: A process is a project defined in UiPath Studio and published in Orchestrator from UiPath Studio or manually.

IsActive.description: Specifies if the process is still active.

SupportsMultipleEntryPoints.description: Specifies if the process has multiple entry points.

RequiresUserInteraction.description: Specifies if the process can run in headless mode.

Title.description: The custom name of the package.

Version.description: The current version of the given package.

Key.description: The unique identifier for the package.

Description.description: Used to add additional information about a package in order to better identify it.

Published.description: The date and time when the package was published or uploaded.

IsLatestVersion.description: Specifies whether the current version is the latest of the given package.

OldVersion.description: Specifies the last version before the current one.

IsCompiled.description: Disable explore packages for compiled processes

ProcessingExceptionDto.description: Stores information about exceptions thrown while processing failed queue items.

Details.description: Stores additional details about the exception.

Type.description: The processing exception type, if any.

AssociatedImageFilePath.description: A path on the robot running computer to an image file that stores relevant information about the exception - e.g. a system print screen.

CreationTime.description: Time when the exception occurred

ProcessScheduleDto.description: Defines the schedule of a process that can be executed at regular intervals, on selected Robots, all of them or a specified number of Robots.

Key.description: The Key of the process schedule.

Enabled.description: Specifies if the schedule is active or not.

Name.description: The name of the schedule.

ReleaseId.description: The Id of the process associated with the schedule.

ReleaseKey.description: The unique key of the process associated with the schedule.

ReleaseName.description: The name of the process associated with the schedule.

PackageName.description: The name of the package to be triggered with the schedule.

EnvironmentName.description: The name of the environment associated with the schedule.

EnvironmentId.description: The Id of the environment associated with the schedule.

JobPriority.description: The execution priority. If null, it will start jobs with the release's priority.

SpecificPriorityValue.description: Value for more granular control over execution priority.

RuntimeType.description: The runtime type of the robot

StartProcessCron.description: The start cron expression of the schedule.

StartProcessCronDetails.description: Various details that can be associated to the time period expression of the schedule.

StartProcessCronSummary.description: Human readable form of cron expression of the schedule.

StartProcessNextOccurrence.description: The date and time when the associated process will be run next.

StartStrategy.description: States which robots from the environment are being run by the schedule.

ExecutorRobots.description: The collection of specific robots selected to be targeted by the current schedule. This collection must be empty if the start strategy is not 0 (specific robots).

StopProcessExpression.description: Number of seconds after which a running process will be stopped.

StopStrategy.description: The way a running process is stopped.

KillProcessExpression.description: Grace period (in seconds) for soft stop. If a process doesn't stop after this amount, it will be killed

ExternalJobKey.description: The unique identifier of the external job associated with the jobs generated by this schedule. A key is generated for each group of jobs triggered by this schedule.

ExternalJobKeyScheduler.description: The unique identifier of the external background task schedule associated with the background tasks generated by this schedule. A key is generated for each batch of background tasks triggered by this schedule.

TimeZoneId.description: The timezone under which the schedule will run.

TimeZoneIana.description: The timezone under which the schedule will run in Iana Standard.

UseCalendar.description: DEPRECATED. Specify whether the schedule uses any calendar.

CalendarId.description: The id of the calendar that a process schedule uses.

InputArguments.description: Input parameters that will be passed to each job created by this schedule.

QueueDefinitionId.description: The Id of the queue that uses this schedule for activation (trigger jobs when new queue items are added)

QueueDefinitionName.description: The Name of the queue that uses this schedule for activation (trigger jobs when new queue items are added)

ItemsActivationThreshold.description: The minimum number of queue items that should trigger the process activation.

ItemsPerJobActivationTarget.description: The target ratio between the number of queue items and the Total number of jobs created by a process.

MaxJobsForActivation.description: The maximum number of jobs that a process can create as result of a Queue driven activation.

RobotDto.description: A Robot is an execution host that runs processes built in UiPath Studio.

LicenseKey.description:
The key is automatically generated from the server for the Robot machine.
<para />For the robot to work, the same key must exist on both the robot and Orchestrator.
<para />All robots on a machine must have the same license key in order to register correctly.

<para />Note: You must use short domain names, such as desktop\administrator and NOT desktop.local/administrator.

Gets or sets flag for honoring initial machine and robot choice upon resumption of created jobs, if jobs are suspended.

CreationTime.description: The date it was uploaded.

TransactionDataDto.description: Stores data sent when processing of an existing or a new item starts.

Name.description: The name of the queue in which to search for the next item or in which to insert the item before marking it as InProgress and sending it to the robot.

RobotIdentifier.description: The unique key identifying the robot that sent the request.

SpecificContent.description:
If not null a new item will be added to the queue with this content before being moved to InProgress state and returned to the robot for processing.
<para />If null the next available item in the list will be moved to InProgress state and returned to the robot for processing.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

Reference.description: An optional, user-specified value for queue item identification.

ReferenceFilterOption.description: Declares the strategy used to filter the Reference value.

TransactionResultDto.description: Stores data sent when processing an item ended.

IsSuccessful.description: States if the processing was successful or not.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

Output.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data resulted after successful processing.

Analytics.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data for further analytics processing.

Progress.description: String field which is used to keep track of the business flow progress.

UserName.description: The UserName used to authenticate on the Host Machine.

Password.description: The Password used to authenticate on the Host Machine.

CredentialStoreId.description: The Credential Store used to store the password.

CredentialExternalName.description: Contains the value of the key in the external store used to store the password.

ExecutionSettings.description: An object containing execution settings for the Robot.

LimitConcurrentExecution.description: Specifies if the robot can be used concurrently on multiple machines

RobotId.description: The actual Id of the provisioned Robot.

UpdatePolicyDto.description: The policy applied for update robots' versions

Type.description: The type of the policy (None/ SpecificVersion/ LatestVersion)

SpecificVersion.description: The specific version used for SpecificVersion policy type

UserDto.description: Stores information about assigned role(s) and email settings, and enables a person or a Robot to login to Orchestrator.

Name.description: The name of the person for which the user is created.

Surname.description: The surname of the person for which the user is created.

UserName.description: The name used to login to Orchestrator.

Domain.description: The domain from which the user is imported

DirectoryIdentifier.description: The directory identifier from which the user is imported

FullName.description: The full name of the person constructed with the format Name Surname.

EmailAddress.description: The e-mail address associated with the user.

IsEmailConfirmed.description: States if the email address is valid or not.

LastLoginTime.description: The date and time when the user last logged in, or null if the user never logged in.

IsActive.description: States if the user is active or not. An inactive user cannot login to Orchestrator.

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the user was created.

AuthenticationSource.description: The source which authenticated this user.

Password.description: The password used during application login.

UserRoles.description: The collection of roles associated with the user.

RolesList.description: The collection of role names associated with the user.

LoginProviders.description: The collection of entities that can authenticate the user.

OrganizationUnits.description: The collection of organization units associated with the user.

TenantId.description: The id of the tenant owning the user.

TenancyName.description: The name of the tenant owning the user.

TenantDisplayName.description: The display name of the tenant owning the user.

TenantKey.description: The key of the tenant owning the user.

MayHaveUserSession.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have a User session (default: true)

MayHaveRobotSession.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have an Attended Robot attached (default: true)

MayHaveUnattendedSession.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have an Unattended Robot attached (default: false)

BypassBasicAuthRestriction.description: Specifies whether this user bypasses the "Auth.RestrictBasicAuthentication" application setting (default: false)

MayHavePersonalWorkspace.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have a Personal Workspace

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the action was performed.

Name.description: Event type key

CreationTime.description: The Creation time of the job

StartTime.description: The date and time when the job execution started or null if the job hasn't started yet.

EndTime.description: The date and time when the job execution ended or null if the job hasn't ended yet.

State.description: The state in which the job is.

Source.description: The Source name of the job.

SourceType.description: The Source type of the job.

BatchExecutionKey.description: The unique identifier grouping multiple jobs. It is usually generated when the job is created by a schedule.

Info.description: Additional information about the current job.

StartingScheduleId.description: The Id of the schedule that started the job, or null if the job was started by the user.

ReleaseName.description: The name of the release associated with the current name.

Type.description: The type of the job, Attended if started via the robot, Unattended otherwise

HostMachineName.description: The name of the machine where the Robot run the job.

InputArguments.description: Input parameters in JSON format to be passed to job execution

OutputArguments.description: Output parameters in JSON format resulted from job execution

RuntimeType.description: The type of license used to run the job

Details.description: Stores additional details about the exception.

Type.description: The processing exception type, if any.

AssociatedImageFilePath.description: A path on the robot running computer to an image file that stores relevant information about the exception - e.g. a system print screen.

Name.description: The name of the schedule.

Enabled.description: Specifies if the schedule is active or not.

EnvironmentId.description: The Id of the environment associated with the schedule.

EnvironmentName.description: The name of the environment associated with the schedule.

StartProcessCron.description: The start cron expression of the schedule.

StartStrategy.description: States which robots from the environment are being run by the schedule.

StopStrategy.description: The way a running process is stopped.

ExternalJobKey.description: The unique identifier of the external job associated with the jobs generated by this schedule. A key is generated for each group of jobs triggered by this schedule.

ExternalJobKeyScheduler.description: The unique identifier of the external background task schedule associated with the background tasks generated by this schedule. A key is generated for each batch of background tasks triggered by this schedule.

TimeZoneId.description: The timezone under which the schedule will run.

TimeZoneIana.description: The timezone under which the schedule will run in Iana Standard.

UseCalendar.description: DEPRECATED. Specify whether the schedule uses a calendar

ExecutorRobots.description: The collection of specific robots selected to be targeted by the current schedule. This collection must be empty if the start strategy is not 0 (specific robots).

InputArguments.description: Input parameters that will be passed to each job created by this schedule.

UserName.description: The name used to login to Orchestrator.

Domain.description: The domain from which the user is imported

FullName.description: The full name of the person constructed with the format Name Surname.

EmailAddress.description: The e-mail address associated with the user.

IsActive.description: States if the user is active or not. An inactive user cannot login to Orchestrator.

LastLoginTime.description: The date and time when the user last logged in, or null if the user never logged in.

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the user was created.

AuthenticationSource.description: The source which authenticated this user.

ReleaseKey.description: The unique key of the release associated with the process.

Strategy.description: States which robots from the environment are being run by the process.

RobotIds.description: The collection of ids of specific robots selected to be run by the current process. This collection must be empty only if the start strategy is not Specific.

JobsCount.description: Number of pending jobs to be created in the environment, for the current process. This number must be greater than 0 only if the start strategy is JobsCount.

Source.description: The Source of the job starting the current process.
